intro: Scutellaria cubensis, commonly known as Cuban skullcap, is a flowering plant native to Cuba and the Caribbean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are usually blue or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. Scutellaria cubensis is characterized by its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its medicinal properties.
